content.question: Consider the results of a hypothesis test, which indicate there is not enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis. Which of the following statements about error is correct?

choices.label: A Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error could have been made, but not a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.

A Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error could have been made, but not a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.

Both types of error could have been made, but the probability of a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error is greater than the probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.

Both types of error could have been made, but the probability of a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error is less than the probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.
The type of error that could have been made is not possible to determine without knowing the statement of the null hypothesis.

content.answer: A Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error could have been made, but not a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
